com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com frank the weiner dog pattern difficulty medium i assume you already know how to crochet how to crochet in the round how to read a pattern and how to sew pieces together supplies size g hook will make approx 6 dog ½ a skein of worsted weight yarn red heart super saver works nicely a scrap of color for the nose gauge is unimportant for this project terms single_crochet = single_crochet increase = increase two single_crochet in same stitch decrease = decrease crochet two stitches together note this weiner dog is worked in the round i join rounds and i single_crochet in the same space as joining so i m assuming that at the end of each round you are slip stitching to the first stitch of that round and that you chain 1 to start the next round you can work in spirals if that s easier for you just remember to mark your rounds you want your stitches tight and close together so the stuffing doesn t show through later on to start each piece you can chain 2 and work your 6 stitches into the 2nd stitch from the hook or you can use the magic magic_ring for this particular pattern there are a lot of little parts i ve found that when you start a round with fewer than 6 stitches you can end up with a bulge or hole in the second round or at least i do… so on these parts i ve instructed you to single_crochet in each single_crochet around including the slip_stitch from the previous round which may be confusing what i mean by this is to go ahead and crochet in the last stitch on the round the one that you made when you slip stitched to the first round this stitch is usually skipped you will have one extra stitch in that round but you are supposed to on these parts you could also just put 2 single_crochet in the last single_crochet if that works better for you or makes more sense page 2 of 8 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com the pattern the head and body row instructions stitches 1 **starting with nose color*** 6 chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet around including the slip_stitch from the previous round 7 3 single_crochet in 6 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in last stitch 8 **change to main body color** 4 single_crochet in next 8 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in last stitch increase 9 5 work even 9 6 *single_crochet
